Generation IV.Diamond: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
Generation IV.Pearl: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
Generation IV.Platinum: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

Generation V.Black: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
Generation V.White: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
Generation V.Black 2: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
Generation V.White 2: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

Generation VI.X: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
Generation VI.Y: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When air fills the flotation sac on its neck, the sac balloons like an inner tube. This Pokémon floats with its head out of the water.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
Generation IX.Violet: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
